subject: RE: [junit] Including test cases with production code
msgSnippet: ... Agreed.   Actually, I don t think they even need the built-in diagnostics. That should be left to customer support (more $$$) :D -Jason
messageBody:
> Can someone explain why someone (i.e. a customer) would
> want to clutter
> their storage or bandwith with test cases? The only
> reason I can think of is
> if your application had the ability to run built-in
> diagnostics that were
> included in order to help track down faults due to unanticipated
> environmental conditions. Other than that, test cases are
> just dead code as
> far as an end-user is concerned.

Agreed. Actually, I don't think they even need the built-in diagnostics.
That should be left to customer support (more $$$) :D

-Jason
